subject: Religion & Spirituality
subcategory: Sacred Texts That Shaped the World
title: Oral vs. Written: When Words Left the Mouth
description: A fast breakdown of Oral vs. Written: When Words Left the Mouth for builders.

hook.text: Every sacred text started as spoken words. Writing them down changed everything. A living voice became a fixed document.

buildup.text: The Vedas, Quran, and Buddhist sutras were oral for centuries. Memory was trusted more than writing in ancient cultures.

discovery.text: Writing froze the text but killed its flexibility. Oral traditions could adapt; written ones became rigid and debatable.

twist.text: Plato warned that writing would destroy memory and understanding. He was partly right. We now worship books, not wisdom.

climax.text: The transition from oral to written changed religion forever. A living tradition became a legal document to argue over.

punchline.text: Writing froze sacred words. Flexible teachings became rigid legal documents.

quiz.question: How did writing down sacred texts change religion?
options: It froze flexible oral traditions into fixed texts that could be debated rigidly
